sen.j: 東儀 俊美（とうぎ としはる、1929年9月14日 -）は、雅楽家、日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: Toshiharu TOGI (September 14, 1929 -) is a gagakuka, or a person who plays old Japanese court music, and is also a member of the Japan Art Academy.
Toshiharu TOGI (September 14, 1929 - year of death unknown) is a gagakuka, or a person who plays old Japanese court music, and is also a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: year of death unknown を追加
sen.e: Toshiharu TOGI (September 14, 1929 - year of death unknown) is a gagakuka, or a person who plays old Japanese court music, and is also a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He is from Tokyo Prefecture.
He is from Tokyo.
He is from Tokyo.

sen.j: 秦河勝以来続くと言われる四天王寺楽家東儀家の出身。
sen.e: He was born to the Togi family, which is one of the Raku family groups in the Shitennoji school that was believed to be founded by HATA no Kawakatsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was born to the Togi family, which is one of the Raku family groups in the Shitennoji school that was believed to be founded by HATA no Kawakatsu.
He was born to the Togi family, which is one of the Raku family groups in the Shitennoji school that was believed to be founded by HATA no Kawakatsu.
His father is Toshisuke Togi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; 俊輔→としすけ(読み方不明)
sen.e: His father is Toshisuke Togi.
His father is Toshisuke Togi.

sen.j: 私立昌平中学校卒、1941年宮内省楽部楽生入学、1949年宮内庁楽部楽師。
sen.e: After graduating from Shohei Junior High School, he entered the Kunaicho gakubu (Music Department of the Imperial Household Agency) in 1941 to study gagaku, and became a master musician of the Kunaicho gakubu in 1949.

After graduating from private Shohei Junior High School, he entered the Kunaicho gakubu (Music Department of the Imperial Household Agency) in 1941 to study gagaku, and became a master musician of the Kunaicho gakubu in 1949.

After graduating from private Shohei Junior High School, he entered the Kunaicho gakubu (Music Department of the Imperial Household Agency) in 1941 to study gagaku, and became a master musician of the Kunaicho gakubu in 1949.
In 1959, he performed in the US.
In 1959, he performed in the United States.
sen.cmt: 国名を正式名に変えました。
sen.e: In 1959, he performed in the United States.
In 1962, he started to study under Komei ABE.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1962, he started to study under Komei ABE.

sen.j: 1990年大嘗祭にて「悠紀地方風俗歌・風俗舞」を作曲、作舞。
sen.e: In 1990, he composed a tune and accompanying dance called 'Yuki Chiho Fuzokuka Fuzokumai' (Folk Song and Dance of the Yuki Region) to be performed at the Daijo-sai festival (festival to celebrate succession of the emperor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; 悠紀地方風俗歌・風俗舞→Yuki Chiho Fuzokuka Fuzokumai' (Folk Song and Dance of the Yuki Region) (読み方&定訳不明)
sen.e: In 1990, he composed a tune and an accompanying dance called 'Yuki Chiho Fuzokuka Fuzokumai' (Folk Song and Dance of the Yuki Region), which was performed at the Daijo-sai festival (festival to celebrate succession of the emperor).
sen.cmt: grammar、分かりやすいように書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1990, he composed a tune and an accompanying dance called 'Yuki Chiho Fuzokuka Fuzokumai' (Folk Song and Dance of the Yuki Region), which was performed at the Daijo-sai festival (festival to celebrate succession of the emperor).

sen.j: 1991年宮内庁楽部楽長、1993年首席楽長。
sen.e: In 1991, he became the Master of the Kunaicho gakubu, and in 1993, he became the Principle Master of the Kunaicho gakubu.
In 1991, he became the Master of the Kunaicho gakubu, and in 1993, the Principle Master of the Kunaicho gakubu.

In 1999, he received the Order of the Rising Sun with Gold and Silver Rays.
In 1999, he received the Order of the Rising Sun with Gold and Silver Rays.
In 1999, he received the Order of the Rising Sun with Gold and Silver Rays.

sen.j: 2000年恩賜賞・日本芸術院賞受賞、日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: In 2000, he received the Onshi Prize and also the Award of the Japan Art Academy, and became a member of the academy.
In 2000, he received the Onshi Prize and the Award of the Japan Art Academy, and became a member of the academy.
sen.cmt: alsoは不要だと判断し、除外しました。
sen.e: In 2000, he received the Onshi Prize and the Award of the Japan Art Academy, and became a member of the academy.

sen.j: 2003年宮内庁楽部技術指導員、2005年退職。
sen.e: In 2003, he became a instructor at the Kunaicho gakubu and resigned in 2005.
